comments.author: Shai Erera
comments.body: Mike, don't you think both statistics are useful: how many unique fields the index holds, and how many of them include norms?

comments.author: Michael McCandless
comments.body:
bq. Mike, don't you think both statistics are useful: how many unique fields the index holds, and how many of them include norms?

Yes, but CheckIndex already has the former (on the test: fields.... output).

description: It simply tells you how many unique fields there are... it should instead only say how many have norms.
summary: CheckIndex overstates how many fields have norms enabled
